msItem.filiation: Also witnessed in CCCC 198, CCCC 303, Vercelli, Bodley 340, and in small part in Tiberius A.iii; see Scragg.

physDesc.p: There are some very small corrections and additions by at least an additional two hands in this homily, but the samples are too small and sparse to assign hands with any surety. Most of these concern exacting tweaks to the Passion retelling, both its Latin and Old English components. Some of the additions may be quite late, as well, possibly even interventions by John Joscelyn.

handNote.p: main hand: late square minuscule, occasional raising of e; makes self corrections by erasing and rewriting or by superlinear addition with slim insertion mark; belly of g very dominant and often extends quite far to the left with rather smaller loop; left branch of y is usually a bit curved; belly of thorn and wynn upward-looking, while still remaining rounded, and quite compact (about half as wide as belly of p). Skilled, very regular, upright, and elegant hand.
